entities.description: Types of weights used in the 2022 NSDUH, including person-level analysis weights, questionnaire dwelling unit (QDU)-level weights, and person pair-level weights.
In-person method of data collection for the survey, with varying proportion by quarter.
Web-based method of data collection for the survey.
Time periods in which the data collection is divided (Quarter 1 to Quarter 4).
Level of education achieved by web respondents, used as a control variable in weighting adjustments.
Variables related to the characteristics of respondents, used for weighting adjustments and analysis.
Distribution of respondents based on geographic location, used for weighting adjustments.
Estimates of mental health issues among adult respondents, impacted by break-off of interviews.
Interviews that provide sufficient information for analysis, including details on substance use.
Weights developed to analyze uncompleted interviews, especially for mental health-related questions.
Dwelling units included in the survey for web-based data collection, with adjustments made for ineligibility.

relationships.description: Relation between the NSDUH survey and the types of analysis weights developed for 2022.
Indicates the use of in-person interviews as a method of data collection.
Indicates the use of web-based interviews as a method of data collection.
Indicates the time period during which the data collection occurs.
Indicates the use of educational attainment as a control variable in weighting adjustments.
Indicates the use of demographic variables in weighting adjustments and analysis.
Indicates the use of geographic distributions in weighting adjustments.
Indicates the impact of interview break-off on the accuracy of adult mental health estimates.
Indicates that the NSDUH survey includes interviews that are considered usable for analysis.
Indicates the use of specific weights to analyze uncompleted (break-off) interviews.
Indicates the inclusion of dwelling units in the survey for web-based data collection.
